text: does anyone have experience with cloud testing in android studio. Does it cost money?
yes, and quite a lot
We’ve used google test cloud and amazons cloud testing
Any1 noticed problems with Robolectric 3.1-SNAPSHOT today?
I never can find clear pricing overview on these things :stuck_out_tongue:
slimmy that’s their point :troll:
I tried google trial last week for something personal. And you get 300$ as trial. And within a few minutes I spend 40$
meh I won’t bother then :stuck_out_tongue: 40$ for a few minutes
I’ll go make my own test lab, with blackjack and hookers!
<@U0K1ALDQE>: my problem is Y U USE robolectric still
:joy:
I don’t understand the hate with Robolectric
I find it much easier to use than instrumentation once it’s setup correctly
You do everything with espresso to test your views?
it allows you to do evil thinks
no man f*** espresso
So you don’t test? :smile:
pssh I test where it matters
<@U0DTEGLJF|blundell> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/blundell/F175SS7L6/screen_shot_2016-04-22_at_16.01.16.png|Screen Shot 2016-04-22 at 16.01.16.png>
unit tests till I die
That’s why I use robolectric :joy:
end-to-end is where espresso lives
unit is where you can just use the Android jar
no need for robolectric
activities only contain updating view and launching intents
And that is all I test with robolectric
so like component tests, ok thats better :simple_smile:
0 logic, that’s decoupled and tested with unit tests
Yes I just use it for component testing
gudt gudt, just don’t like it when people use robolectric for unit tests
No need to use it for unit tests lol
Okay I understand your frustration now :smile:
makes the layers on that pyramid less obvious and turns more into a pile of spaghetti!
:smile:
It was just with 3.1-SNAPSHOT today AS cannot find the dependencies. And so my component test fails
so no I don’t know what’s up with the snapshot. But Y U USE snapshots :stuck_out_tongue:
I stepped back from snapshots
I’m on stable now and it’s working fine again :simple_smile:
stable much better idea
maybe you could script it so that if it fails withsnapshot it runs again on stable :simple_smile: or it only runs snapshots on Fridays (if you wanna alway try the latest build for some reason)

attachments.fallback: [May 9th, 2016 1:12 AM] blundell: unit tests till I die

damn, it’s too early to be hungry!
yeah shtap
i do have to eat around 10:30 tho I never make it to lunch lol
I'm on board with the no Robolectric train but yesterday I think I found a reason to use it, I will post in a bit to get your guys' opinions
<@U09T8SFG8>: looking forward to that!
<@U0548MM6B>: No such thing as to early to be hungry. I eat left over dinner for breakfast @ 6.30am all the time :joy:
<@U0K1ALDQE>: pffft normie :stuck_out_tongue: I usually skip breakfast and then wait for lunch like it’s a blessing from the gods :joy:
<@U176JJ86L|distinctlines> has joined the channel
<@U17730SG6|veradiego31> has joined the channel
on one project we wrapped ContentValues in our own class, and then just converted it at the last minute. Works but can become a rabbit hole
Hmm that might make some sense because I am already kind of wrapping `Cursor` to provide some better functionality. <@U0DTEGLJF> how did that turn into a rabbit hole though?
you wrap ConventValues, then your like hmm what else should I wrap
:smile:

That's true.. I think I will go with something similar for now since I know that there are only two places that I need such functionality. I will probably make a `BetterContentValues` with a `setContentValues(values)`, a `clear()` and all the `put` methods and use that. If I see that I have even more places where problems like these pop up I might use Robolectric.._might_ :stuck_out_tongue:

I found another option for anyone running to this problem. PowerMock offers mocking the constructors of classes with `whenNew(ContentValues.class).withArguments().thenReturn(mock(ContentValues.class));`. This is quite dirty though.
<@U178FMZ96|brzi_subasa> has joined the channel
<@U17ABNLDQ|moggytech> has joined the channel
hey guys, i’m running into a tight deadline and am stuck on something… wondering if anyone can help me out
anyone know how to print an activity?
or an easy to to take an activity layout and print that?
I’ve tried playing around with this library, and i keep running into issues:  <https://github.com/HendrixString/Android-PdfMyXml>

attachments.title: HendrixString/Android-PdfMyXml
attachments.text: Android-PdfMyXml - convert android xml layouts into PDF document, works on all versions of Android.

text: <@U0MKPH43Y>: I bet you can post a question in their issues too
Haven't seen that lib around here
yeah, i just doubt that they would get back to me quickly
i’ll try though
i’m reading about pdf generation in android and right now it actually doesn’t seem that hard
if i can create the pdf, then i should be able to print it just fine
You can also try to take a screenshot somehow
And print that?
yeah not a bad idea
Screenshot + ctlr + p?
Has anyone else had weird behavior with the spacing between RecyclerView elements? Every time I return the screen with the list, the spacing between elements has increased.
do you use addItemDecoration ?
Yeah, the issue was my init cycle was added it multiple time.
was relying on invalidateItemDecorations(), but that doesn’t seem to be fully functional
thanks for your help <@U061HDV96>, I got it working!  Though I didn’t post a question on the library, just talking it through with you helped me really think about it some and figure it out
Is it normal that I get a Gradle sync everytime I add a new Fragment? It takes like 5 seconds, but I really don't see a reason for it.
<@U163T1S93>: you mean android studio prompts you to resync gradle whenever you use the wizard to create a new fragment?
that would be strange
<@U0546QERR>: No, but the bar saying Gradle is syncing pops up
yes, thanks me :simple_smile:
Why doesn’t android studio have the manifest editor like the old eclipse IDE
*Unit Test Question*: Does anyone know if it is possible to see code coverage in Android Studio? (Not to execute the gradle task to generate the report but actually see it, ideally for each line)
<@U0LP46HFV> when i run tests with coverage (the run button next to debug) it highlights the lines that were hit during the test run
no idea how that works though :stuck_out_tongue:
<@U0546QERR>: can you share a screenshot of that by any chance?
hmm i'm trying but apparently kotlin plugin isn't installed on this machine :x gimme a min
<@U0546QERR|damien5314> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/damien5314/F17CYLHV0/screenshot_2016-05-09_13.43.45.png|Screenshot 2016-05-09 13.43.45.png>
the highlighting is added to the left margin, green lines mean you hit that line of code during your tests somewhere
and you can click on it to get a "hit" count
that is using the Intellij IDEA code coverage runner, i believe you can switch to jacoco in your test run configuration but not sure how the highlighting works then
<@U0546QERR>: you should look into using `Objects.requireNotNull()` or using a Preconditions class similar to Guava's
cleans up all those IllegalStateExceptions
nice, will look into that
<@U0LP46HFV>: yes you can.
nice, thanks <@U0546QERR>
hello
